lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

public Event(String dscp, String from, String to) {
return "[E] [" + getStatus() + "] " + dscp + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* This class exists to avoid classpath/module issues when launching JavaFX.
* Parses a create command and returns the Task to be added.
* Throws SaruException if the command is invalid.
* Parses a create command (todo, deadline, event) and returns the Task to be added.
* @return A Task instance created from the command.
* @throws SaruException If the command format is invalid.
public static Task parseCreateCommand(String input) throws SaruException {
throw new SaruException("Todo needs a description. Example: todo borrow book");
throw new SaruException("Deadline needs a description. Example: deadline return book /by Sunday");
throw new SaruException("Invalid date. Use yyyy-mm-dd, e.g. 2019-10-15");
throw new SaruException("Event needs a description. Example: event project meeting /from 2pm /to 4pm");
throw new SaruException("I don't understand that command.");
* Parses an integer index from a string.
* @param s String that should contain an integer.
* @throws SaruException If the string is not a valid integer.
public static int parseIndexOrThrow(String s) throws SaruException {
throw new SaruException("Please provide a valid task number.");
* Main entry point of the Saru task manager application.
* Coordinates user interaction (Ui), persistence (Storage), and task operations (TaskList).
return "Hello! I'm Saru\nWhat can I do for you?";
* Constructs a Saru application with default UI and storage.
* Loads any previously saved tasks from storage.
* Runs the main command loop until the user exits with "bye".
* Commands are read from Ui and executed by delegating to other classes.
ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
ui.showMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:");
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new SaruException("Please provide a keyword to search.");
ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents the list of tasks currently managed by the application.
* Provides basic operations such as add/remove/get and view accessors.
* Constructs a task list from an existing list.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Removes a task at the given zero-based index.
* @param indexZeroBased Zero-based index of the task to remove.
* Returns the task at the given zero-based index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the underlying list (mutable). Used for saving.
* Returns an unmodifiable view of the tasks list.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
